alert.note: Alert for Lee (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 2:10AM EST until February 19 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Kentucky... Kentucky River at Heidelberg affecting Lee County. South Fork Kentucky River at Booneville affecting Owsley County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO LATE SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Kentucky River at Heidelberg. * WHEN...From early this morning to late Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Low lying areas flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:45 AM EST Friday the stage was 20.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:45 AM EST Friday was 20.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest near 21.8 feet just after midnight early Saturday morning. The river should fall below flood stage early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 21.9 feet on 03/06/1945. &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. The next statement will be issued by 3 PM EST.
